bibl.title: Aurelius Gaius (AE 1981.777) and Imperial Journeys, 293-299.
bibl.note: Supplement to: Idem, The Sarmatian and the Indians. A New Satirical Epigram on the Victory Titles of Galerius, ZPE 183 (2012) pp. 39-52. - The funerary monument of the soldier Aurelius Gaius (S.E.G. XXXI, 1116; A.E. 1981, 777) is very relevant to the discussion of the tetrarchic campaings conducted in Egypt between 293 and 301/2.
bibl.seg: Wilkinson Kevin W., Aurelius Gaius (AE 1981.777) and Imperial Journeys, 293-299.

Supplement to: Idem, The Sarmatian and the Indians. A New Satirical Epigram on the Victory Titles of Galerius, ZPE 183 (2012) pp. 39-52. - The funerary monument of the soldier Aurelius Gaius (S.E.G. XXXI, 1116; A.E. 1981, 777) is very relevant to the discussion of the tetrarchic campaings conducted in Egypt between 293 and 301/2.
